g.text: soft X-ray microscopic photoelectron spectroscopy under
charge-discharge control of single crystalline Licoo
(Lco) particles as an active electrode material for
an all solid-state lithium-ion battery (LiB). photoelectron mapping and the photoelectron spectrum of
a selected microscopic region are obtained by a customized
cell for LIBs. During the charge
process, a more effective Li extraction from a side facet of the single crystalline LCO particle than from
the central part is observed, which ensures the reliability of the system as an
photoelectron analyzer that can track changes in the electronic structure of a selected part of the
active particle. Based on these assessments, the no drastic change in the Co 2
charge-discharge of LCO supports that the charge-polarization may occur at the oxygen side by strong
orbitals. the success of tracking the electronic-structure change
at each facet of a single crystalline electrode material during charge-discharge is a major step toward
the fabrication of innovative active electrode materials for LiBs.
Development of high-performance lithium-ion batteries (LIBs) with large energy density, high power perfor-
mance, high charge-discharge cycle stability, and high safety is strongly demanded to promote the use of clean
energy devices, such as electric vehicles, to build a sustainable low-carbon society
negative electrode materials for LIBs, strategies for the materials design have been established and metal lith-
ium or silicon-lithium alloys have attracted much attention as high capacity materials
for such innovative materials to be used at the positive electrode have not been established because there are
a lot of unknown charge-discharge mechanisms that occur at the positive electrode
uation, researchers have undertaken cutting-edge analytical techniques to further understand these positive
electrode materials and to create a strategy for materials design. Various kinds of analytical techniques, like
, annular bright-field and high-angle annular dark
in the research of battery materials, and these methods have unveiled a lot of information on the microscopic
structures in LIBs, such as the partial structure of organic compounds at the solid-electrolyte interface, distribu-
tions of each element like lithium, metal, and oxygen, and cross-sectional mapping information in a large area of
Institute for Solid State Physics, The University of Tokyo, Kashiwa, Chiba, 277-8581, Japan.
Energy Conservation, National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science and Technology, Tsukuba, Ibaraki, 305-8568,
AIST-UTokyo Advanced Operando-Measurement Technology Open Innovation Laboratory (OPERANDO-
OIL), National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science and Technology (AIST), Kashiwa, Chiba, 277-8565, Japan.

PRESTO, Japan Science and Technology Agency, 4-1-8, Honcho,
Institute of Materials Structure Science, High Energy Accelerator Research
